channel.title: Star Wars (2015) on jverkamp.com
channel.description: Recent content in Star Wars (2015) on jverkamp.com

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 13: Rogues and Rebels
item.description:
And now everyone‚Äôs back together for one giant showdown. Champions, rock monsters, and all!

It‚Äôs all quite exciting in all the best science fantasy sorts of ways Star Wars has to offer!

Quite a way to end this particular series. Whatever could be next?!

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 12: Rebels and Rogues
item.description:
All of our lives, we have fought this war. Tonight I believe we can end it. Tonight is not an accident. There are no accidents. We have not come here by chance. I do not believe in chance. When I see three objectives, three captains, three ships. I do not see coincidence, I see providence. I see purpose. I believe it our fate to be here. It is our destiny. I believe this night holds for each and every one of us, the very meaning of our lives.

Wait. No. Wrong franchise.

It doesn‚Äôt help when that‚Äôs their disguise garb.

Luke‚Äôs off to lure some imperial probes away, Han and Leia are going to try to trick criminals (and perhaps an old ex) into fighting a war for them, and Chewie and C-3PO? Well, they have a planet to blow up.

What could possibly go wrong?

A thrilling‚Ä¶ part one!

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 11: The Scourging of Shu-Torun
item.description:
Princess Leia has a plan! Economic upset on a massive scale… and if it happens to come with revenge against a certain recent traitor to the Rebellion? All the better.

What could go wrong?

(It’s even better, as Luke was just looking for them…)

It‚Äôs quite cinematic. Fetch quests, exotic locales, a crazy multipliprong battle with stakes both huge and personal‚Ä¶

I quite enjoyed this one.

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 10: The Escape
item.description:
Well…

What if what could happen were more akin to a forced vacation? Stranded alone on a world with a strict isolationist policy. No transmitters. No traffic in or out other than every six months.

It’s a neat story. Interesting to see which of our heroes adapts to the quiet life… and which very much do not.

Plus, hints of the wider Star Wars universe. Lightsaber proof shields. Massive beasties to hunt–in defense of the town. A Jedi in love. And maybe a way away from all that war…

A good one.

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 9: Hope Dies
item.description:
Betrayed!

Of course. It was all going too well. And now we get an entire volume of death and destruction, trying desperately to claw every scrap they can away from being destroyed by Vader and the Empire.

Quite exciting. What‚Äôs next?!

(The attached annual, if somewhat shorter, is also a really fun story. Sith artifacts that should have stayed buried and accidental pod racing‚Ä¶ oh my.)

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 8: Mutiny at Mon Cala
item.description:
How the Mon Calamari came to join the rebellion.

It‚Äôs got it all. Double crosses. Triple crosses. Prison breaks. Kidnapping. Impersonation. A big space battle. An opera! An encore!

Everything.

A solid action story.

And a hint right at the end‚Äîthat everything is about to change.

Onward!

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 7: The Ashes of Jedha
item.description:
It‚Äôs quite the story. A shattered planet with a truly giant hole down to the mantle. Another Force cult. (When you stare into the abyss‚Ä¶) Some new Imperial baddies.

This one has it all.

Got away from the series for a bit. This was a great place to pick it back up!

Onward.

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 6: Out Among the Stars
item.description:
STAR WARS #33-37 Annual #3

So many different stories in this one!

We have the beach episode.

A Lando Calrissian and Sana Starros team up‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶double (triple? Quadruple?!) cross!

Han (with a weirdly photorealistic face) and Chewie transporting a Hutt:

And R2-D2 on a mission!

I‚Äôd ‚Ä¶ forgotten that C-3PO had gotten captured.

And if that wasn‚Äôt enough, Scar Squadron‚Äîand our favorite Storm Trooper with a lightsaber.

That‚Äôs still weird to type.

I do enjoy the idea of a Storm Trooper just trying to do the right thing‚Äîthat doesn‚Äôt actually join or even support the Rebellion. It‚Äôs a neat story we haven‚Äôt gotten in the movies/TV (that I‚Äôve seen).

It‚Äôs quite the mix and feels a bit disjoined, but I enjoyed it all well enough. I just was hoping for a bit more closure.

item.title: Star Wars: The Screaming Citadel
item.description:
Crossover!

With Doctor Aphra‚Ä¶ and Black Krrsantan? (And the droids of course).

That certainly has potential! Force Vampires! (of course that‚Äôs a thing) The titular ‚ÄúScreaming Citadel‚Äù‚Äîdelightfully Gothic. Mind control brain crabs. It‚Äôs got it all!

It‚Äôs a little ridiculous at times and leans far more into the fantasy side of Star Wars, but I enjoyed it.

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 5: Yoda's Secret War
item.description:
C-3PO has been captured!

And I‚Äôm not sure who‚Äôs the worse off for it. üòÑ

It‚Äôs not entirely clear if Darth Vader recognizes him or not. With as many memory wipes as C-3PO has apparently gone through, it‚Äôs worth wondering if he‚Äôs still even the same as he was when Anakin first built him‚Ä¶

But really, in an interesting sort of flip, most of this volume is the backstory! And‚Äîas might be hinted at by the title‚Äîwe actually get pre-Prequel era Yoda! And Qui-Gon Jinn. Now I want to read more Qui-Gon Jinn stories. I wonder if that‚Äôs a thing.

Anyways, Yoda on a planet of feral‚Äîand force sensitive because of course‚Äîchildren. Because of course that‚Äôs a story that has to be in the Star Wars canon. It actually gets far more interesting that I expected, but as Star Wars (outside of the movies) seems wont to do‚Ä¶ things get weird.

It‚Äôs a fascinating story, but again falls a bit into ‚Äòjust how much did Luke do outside of the movies‚Äô trap that just feels weird.

Onward!

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 4: Last Flight of the Harbinger
item.description:
Two main plots this time: good guys and bad guys‚Äîit‚Äôs all in your point of view and the Big Three steal something even bigger.

It‚Äôs fascinating how these stories at once seem smaller and more compact‚Äînot able to stretch out on the big screen‚Äîand at the same time tackle things the movies couldn‚Äôt dare to approach in two hours.

Worth a read!

On a side note: how much or how little the artwork looks like Mark Hammill/Harrison Ford/Carrie Fisher varies widely, especially if you include issue covers.

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 3: Rebel Jail
item.description:
Backstory! Work Obi-Wan and Luke‚Äôs uncle. A prison hidden tucked right up against a sun. Hearding Nerfs. Sana, Leia, and Aphra‚Ä¶ working together?

It‚Äôs a decent enough adventure with quite the set pieces. I just wish I had more time in Obi-Wan‚Äôs backstory now!

item.title: Vader Down
item.description:
And now things get complicated‚Ä¶ Vader Down is a crossover between Star Wars (2015), Star Wars: Darth Vader (2015) and a single standalone issue. It‚Äôs a neat story, but out so I wish there were easier to read on Marvel Unlimited‚Ä¶

Turns out Anakin can still fly‚Ä¶

Anyways, Vader is forced down. One thing leads to another and the Rebellion decides that an entire battalion might be needed to keep him down.

This may not be enough.

It‚Äôs nice to see Dr. Aphra again. Been a a bit. And oh the droids.

For as annoying as it is to switch from series to series, that‚Äôs quite an enjoyable story.

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 2: Showdown on the Smuggler's Moon
item.description:
The continuing in between adventures of all our original trilogy friends!

It‚Äôs a fun one, a dueling pair of adventures and a bit of backstory bridging the original trilogy and the prequels. I think that‚Äôd be an interesting era to read more about. How exactly did things go so badly so quickly.

item.title: Star Wars Vol. 1: Skywalker Strikes
item.description:
Let’s read another Marvel Star Wars series! This time, getting a bit away from Vadar, we have Star Wars (2015). Set (initially) right after A New Hope, we have the fallout of the (first) Death Star and the whole gang out on a variety of adventures!

Overall, it’s a fun start. I’m looking forward to seeing where they go from here!
